Global

SfdxConfig

SfdxConfig

The files where sfdx config values are stored for projects and the global space.

Note: It is not recommended to instantiate this object directly when resolving config values. Instead use SfdxConfigAggregator

Constructor

new SfdxConfig()

See:
  • https://developer.salesforce.com/docs/atlas.en-us.sfdx_dev.meta/sfdx_dev/sfdx_dev_cli_config_values.htm
Example
const localConfig = await SfdxConfig.retrieve<SfdxConfig>();
localConfig.set('defaultusername', 'username@company.org');
await localConfig.write();

Extends

  • ConfigFile

Members

(static) DEFAULT_DEV_HUB_USERNAME :string

Username associated with the default dev hub org.

Type:
  • string

(static) DEFAULT_USERNAME :string

Username associate with the default org.

Type:

The sid for the debugger configuration.

Type:
  • string

The url for the debugger configuration.

Type:
  • string

Methods

(async, static) clear() → {Promise.<void>}

Clear all the configured properties both local and global.

Returns:
Type
Promise.<void>

(async, static) create(options) → {Promise.<SfdxConfig>}

Creates an instance of an SfdxConfig.

Example
const config: SfdxConfig = await Sfdx.create<SfdxConfig>({ isGlobal: false }};
config.set(allowedPropertyKey, value);
await config.write();
Parameters:
Name Type Description
options ConfigOptions

The config options.
Throws:

  • {name: 'InvalidInstanceUrl'} Invalid instance URL.

    Type
    SfdxError

  • {name: 'InvalidApiVersion'} Invalid API version.

    Type
    SfdxError
Returns:

An instance of SfdxConfig.

Type
Promise.<SfdxConfig>

Returns:

Returns an object representing the supported allowed properties.

Type
Array.<ConfigPropertyMeta>

The value of a supported config property.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
isGlobal boolean

True for a global config. False for a local config.

The name of the property to set.

unset(key) → {boolean}

Inherited From:
  • BaseConfigStore#unset

Returns true if an element in the config object existed and has been removed, or false if the element does not exist. BaseConfigStore.has(key) will return false afterwards.

Parameters:
Name Type Description

The key.
Returns:
Type

unsetAll(keys) → {boolean}

Inherited From:
  • BaseConfigStore#unsetAll

Returns true if all elements in the config object existed and have been removed, or false if all the elements do not exist (some may have been removed). BaseConfigStore.has(key) will return false afterwards.

Parameters:
Name Type Description
keys Array.<string>
